markdown:
[The Looksee Man](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2453) **Source** [Pathfinder #187: The Seventh Arch](/Sources.aspx?ID=192) pg. 39 **Perception** +14; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12)darkvision **Languages** [Aklo](/Languages.aspx?ID=13), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [D'ziriak](/Languages.aspx?ID=58), [Draconic](/Languages.aspx?ID=2), [Shadowtongue](/Languages.aspx?ID=21), [Sylvan](/Languages.aspx?ID=10) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +10, [Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2) +12, [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4) +12, [Medicine](/Skills.aspx?ID=9) +10, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) +8, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11) +12, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +10 **Str** +0 **Dex** +4 **Con** +2 **Int** +4 **Wis** +3 **Cha** -2 **Items** [Dagger](/Weapons.aspx?ID=3), [greater stalk goggles](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1821), [Padded Armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=3), ring with Nethys mask sigil (bonded item worth 4 gp), spellbook --- **AC** 21 **Fort** +11 **Ref** +14 **Will** +14 **HP** 70 **Shadow Blending** When the Looksee Man is concealed as a result of dim light, the f at check to target him has a DC of 7, not 5.
**Stalk Goggles** Specialist As long as he wears his [_greater stalk goggles_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1821), the Looksee Man can't be fanked by creatures of 4th level or lower. --- **Speed** 25 feet **Melee** dagger +12 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [versatile S](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)), **Damage** 1d4 piercing **Ranged** dagger +12 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [thrown 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=195), [versatile S](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)), **Damage** 1d4 piercing **Wizard Prepared Spells** DC 21, attack +14 - **Cantrips (2nd)** [Mage Hand](/Spells.aspx?ID=177), [Shield](/Spells.aspx?ID=280), [Tanglefoot](/Spells.aspx?ID=330) - **1st** [Magic Missile](/Spells.aspx?ID=180), [Shocking Grasp](/Spells.aspx?ID=283) - **2nd** [Acid Arrow](/Spells.aspx?ID=2), [Scorching Ray](/Spells.aspx?ID=992) (2), [Spider Climb](/Spells.aspx?ID=299) **Transmutation School Spell 1 Focus Point,** - **1st** [Physical Boost](/Spells.aspx?ID=533) **Occult Innate Spells** DC 21 - **1st** [Illusory Disguise](/Spells.aspx?ID=159) **Shadow Stride** ([Illusion](/Traits.aspx?ID=92), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120), [Shadow](/Traits.aspx?ID=143)) **Requirements** The Looksee Man is in dim light; **Effect** The Looksee Man Strides. He has a +10-foot status bonus to his Speed during this Stride. The DC from shadow blending increases to 11 during this Stride, and the Looksee Man remains concealed by dim light until the end of the movement, even if he leaves dim light during the Stride.
name: The Looksee Man

text: The Looksee Man The Looksee Man Source Pathfinder #187: The Seventh Arch pg. 39 Perception +14; darkvisiondarkvision Languages Aklo, Common, D'ziriak, Draconic, Shadowtongue, Sylvan Skills Acrobatics +10, Arcana +12, Crafting +12, Medicine +10, Nature +8, Occultism +12, Stealth +10 Str +0 Dex +4 Con +2 Int +4 Wis +3 Cha -2 Items Dagger, greater stalk goggles, Padded Armor, ring with Nethys mask sigil (bonded item worth 4 gp), spellbook --- AC 21 Fort +11 Ref +14 Will +14 HP 70 Shadow Blending When the Looksee Man is concealed as a result of dim light, the f at check to target him has a DC of 7, not 5. Stalk Goggles Specialist As long as he wears his greater stalk goggles , the Looksee Man can't be fanked by creatures of 4th level or lower. --- Speed 25 feet Melee Single Action dagger +12 (Agile, versatile S), Damage 1d4 piercing Ranged Single Action dagger +12 (Agile, thrown 10 feet, versatile S), Damage 1d4 piercing Wizard Prepared Spells DC 21, attack +14 - Cantrips (2nd) Mage Hand, Shield, Tanglefoot - 1st Magic Missile, Shocking Grasp - 2nd Acid Arrow, Scorching Ray (2), Spider Climb Transmutation School Spell 1 Focus Point, - 1st Physical Boost Occult Innate Spells DC 21 - 1st Illusory Disguise Shadow Stride Single Action (Illusion, Occult, Shadow) Requirements The Looksee Man is in dim light; Effect The Looksee Man Strides. He has a +10-foot status bonus to his Speed during this Stride. The DC from shadow blending increases to 11 during this Stride, and the Looksee Man remains concealed by dim light until the end of the movement, even if he leaves dim light during the Stride.
